message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public boolean isFibonacci(ArrayList<Integer> arr) {
    if(arr.size() < 3) return false;
    for(int i = 2; i < arr.size(); i++) {
        if(arr.get(i) != arr.get(i-1) + arr.get(i-2)) return false;
    }
    return true;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Fibonacci sequence is defined as each number being the sum of the two preceding ones. So, you can check if the array is part of the Fibonacci sequence by iterating over the array starting from the third element and checking if each element is the sum of the two preceding ones. If you find an element that does not satisfy this condition, you return false. If you reach the end of the array without finding such an element, you return true.
